DOC.brief_summary: The objective PROTECT study : - To assess role CT pulmonary angiography risk stratification hemodynamically stable patient acute symptomatic pulmonary embolism ( PE ) . - To assess role transthoracic echocardiography risk stratification hemodynamically stable patient acute symptomatic PE . - To assess role 2 biomarkers ( troponin brain natriuretic peptide ) risk stratification hemodynamically stable patient acute symptomatic PE . - To assess role Pulmonary Embolism Severity Index ( PESI ) risk stratification hemodynamically stable patient acute symptomatic PE . - To assess combined role CT pulmonary angiography , transthoracic echocardiography , PESI , troponin I brain natriuretic peptide risk stratification hemodynamically stable patient acute symptomatic PE .
DOC.brief_title: Prognostic Value Computed Tomography ( CT ) Scan Hemodynamically Stable Patients With Acute Symptomatic Pulmonary Embolism
DOC.criteria: Acute symptomatic Pulmonary Embolism ( PE ) confirm : CT pulmonary angiography positive PE Ventilation/ perfusion lung scan high likelihood PE ( accord PIOPED criterion ) V/Q ventilation/ perfusion lung scan inconclusive PE negative CT pulmonary angiography patient thoracic symptom low limb ultrasound show positive diagnosis deep vein thrombosis . Contraindication CT pulmonary angiography ( allergy iodine contrast creatinin clearance < 30 ml/min ) . Informed consent obtain . Pregnancy . Life expectancy le 3 month . Hemodynamic unstability define SBP < 90 mm Hg , need cardiopulmonary reanimation , need vasoactive drug orotracheal intubation . Thrombectomy , insertion filter cava vein , need fibrinolytic treatment PE episode . Participation another clinical trial treatment PE .
